titleStmt.title: Dr Dorislaw's ghost, presented by time to unmask the vizards of the Hollanders; and discover the lions paw in the face of the sun, in this juncture of time or, a list of XXVII barbarous and bloody cruelties and murthers, massacres and base treacheries of the Hollanders against England and English men: with the particulars of the noble usages of England to them in their necessities, which might have taught them better manners; and would have engaged some savage nations to have given a better return from bare principles of nature.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by R.I. for T. Hinde, and N. Brooke, and are to be sold at their shops at the Black Bull and Angel in Corn-hill neare the Royall Exchange,

notesStmt.note: The engraving is an allegorical representation of the conduct of the Dutch toward the English.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: their shops at the Black Bull
